intro: Taraxacum breviscapum, commonly known as the short-horned dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and a short, sturdy stem that supports a single flower head. Its flowers are yellow and produce wind-dispersed seeds, typical of the dandelion genus. Taraxacum breviscapum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky slopes, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
